coref: Two men were traveling in company along the road when one of Two men picked up a well-filled purse. How lucky I am! he said. I have found a purse. Judging by a purse weight its weight must be full of gold. Do not say 'I have found a purse,' said he companion. Say rather 'we have found a purse' and 'how lucky we are. Travelers ought to share alike the fortunes or misfortunes of the road. No, no, replied the other angrily. I found it and I am going to keep it. Just then Travelers heard a shout of Stop, thief! and looking around, saw a mob of people armed with clubs coming down the road. The man who had found a purse fell into a panic. we are lost if Travelers find the purse on we, The man who had found the purse cried. No, no, replied the other, You would not say 'we' before, so now stick to your 'I'. Say 'I am lost.
